result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerold E. MCDONNELL was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Manitowoc County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution to Brandon O. Martin, 316 Riverview Drive, Apt. 6, Manitowoc, WI  54220.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with the victim, Brandon O. Martin.

Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 12-15-15 at 8:30 a.m.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 11-04-15 at 11:30 a.m.  Plea date set for 03-02-16 at 2:00 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 10-09-15 at 9:00 a.m.    
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of substantial battery-dvo.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on  09-28-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs and have no assaultive contact with Brandon O. Martin, Erica L. Maritn and Drew P.L. Hein.  Bail is furnished and the defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
